Job Description About the role We are looking for a machine learning engineer to join Arm’s data and artificial intelligence Artificial Intelligence research team. column12: partners

column8: and comparability are field leading. Nonetheless
column9: current mass spectrometer analysis is limited to relative quantitation ex. how abundant a substance is relative to something else. Our technical sophistication has allowed us to push the boundary of this limitation and approximate absolute quantitation ex. the concentration of a substance in a mixture. This role will leverage their skills to extract meaningful structures ex. an underlying structure which might consume a metabolic profile and output a distance” to a disease state in support of biological insights into fundamental questions of human health. column1: Xylem |ˈzīləm| 1 The tissue in plants that brings water upward from the roots; 2 a leading global water technology company. We’re a global team unified in a common purpose creating advanced technology solutions to the world’s water challenges. Developing new technologies that will improve the way water is used, conserved, and re used in the future is central to our work. Our products and services move, treat, analyze, monitor and return water to the environment, in public utility, industrial, residential and commercial building services settings. Xylem also provides a leading portfolio of smart metering, network technologies and advanced analytics solutions for water, electric and gas utilities. In more than 150 countries, we have strong, long standing relationships with customers who know us for our powerful combination of leading product brands and applications expertise with a strong focus on developing comprehensive, sustainable solutions. For more information, please visit us at www.xylem.com If you are excited and passionate about helping us solve water, we want to hear from you! The Role Xylem seeks to hire a Data Scientist with a desire to join a team delivering Big Data applications in the Cloud. We’re focused on helping utility companies visualize and make use of the petabytes of data coming in from their smart meters so they can lower costs and reduce consumption. This is a market poised for explosive growth and this team is ready to take advantage of it. Essential Duties Principal Responsibilities Data curation Develop statistical modeling techniques for pattern recognition problems. Develop code in R, Java, Python, or other languages for statistical analysis, optimization, and simulation. Build models that maximize performance and accuracy. Strategic planning and project management. Minimum Qualifications Education, Experience, Skills, Abilities, License Certification BS Degree Master’s preferred Statistics, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Applied Math; or equivalent. 0 – 3 years of data science experience. Experience with statistical and mathematical software Proven ability to develop system prototypes. SQL skills Excellent oral and written communication skills. Strong documentation skills. Understanding of machine learning techniques and the ability to invent. Big data experience Hadoop, Spark, Map reduce, Hive, etc. Experience with Agile methodology or similar lean startup approach to building software. Experience with time series or signal processing analytics. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. The person must be able to work closely with development teams and or solution architects, in a global environment, and provide the proper technical mentorship utilizing industry standard methodologies. They must have excellent leadership skills and the ability to strongly influence their peers. In addition they must be comfortable working against tight deadlines and solve considerable technical challenges. column1: Cognitive Implementation Developer 138880 United States NC Raleigh | Full time FT | Technology [IT] | Job ID 138880 Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer The role sits within IT GCTO End User Services in the Cognitive and Digital Services department. The C&DS team is building a top to bottom IT capability in support of Automation and Artificial Intelligence services, including IPSoft’s Amelia Virtual Agent and other products. The role is for a cognitive developer providing to implement current future solutions in the C&DS department. We Offer Exposure to new technologies like Artificial Intelligence ML, automation, etc. Exciting challenging work. A team that follows agile methodology. A phenomenal team spirit. A sense of achievement when you go home every day. The role will entail Supporting end to end development and implementation of Business Process Networks BPNs. Supporting and creating Apache Camel integrations with various services. Supporting and developing Groovy scripts within Business Process Networks BPNs. Investigating, debugging and resolving reported issues. Helping in the design and development of creative automated solutions to difficult problems. Partnering with stakeholders and vendors. Participating in various scrum meetings like daily standups, sprint planning sessions, etc. Success in this role entails Meeting demanding project deadlines on time. Demonstrating ownership of project deliverables. Improving the CDS reputation for stable, performant, reliable solutions that enable efficiency. Enjoying your work. You Offer Required You have experience developing in one of the major languages C, Java, Python, JavaScript etc. You have an understanding of web services REST, SOAP, etc. You hold a bachelor degree in Computer Science or have a minimum of 4 years development experience. Additional qualifications You have an understanding of testing fundamentals and experience developing JUnit tests. You hold experience developing RESTful APIs. You bear experience supporting developing automation solutions. Ownership and Accountability – A readiness to pick up and own tasks and be responsible for the future outcome, whether good or bad. You are dynamic and bursting with innovative, creative, ambitious ideas. You love and have pride in your work. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. Credit Suisse complies with applicable federal, state, and local laws prohibiting discrimination in employment in every jurisdiction in which it maintains facilities. Subject to applicable law and regulatory requirements, Credit Suisse complies with state and local laws regarding considering for employment qualified individuals with criminal histories.

column1: Business Quality Analyst 133169 United States NC Raleigh | Full time FT | Technology [IT] | Job ID 133169 Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer Executive summary of the job’s core purpose. Business & Quality Analyst to support Finance Change programs, including key business initiatives across the bank’s front to back infrastructure. Programs comprise both function specific and firm wide projects. Role resides in Product Control IT supports the Finance Guardians of the Bank’s trading activities within the Risk & Finance IT Department supports multiple Risk and Finance functions. Product Control IT includes systems for generating and reporting P&L, reconciliations and control functions such as Sub Ledger, General Ledger and Price Testing. Department creates cutting edge business solutions and aims to deliver strategic initiatives demonstrating deep functional and technical expertise. Role involves demonstrating solid business analysis and quality assurance skills. You will build designs, tests and delivers solutions to meet business needs. Responsibilities include translation of business requirements into user documentation and ensuring all partners business and technical have a clear and common understanding of both the business priorities, needs and the proposed solutions. Role will entail liaising with multiple business units and IT groups to gather, document, understand and communicate the needs and requirements of the business users. This includes partnerships with our key partners across Finance, especially Product Control, Group Finance, Tax, Finance Change and other groups. You will be engaged in our Agile and DevOps transformation and have an opportunity to work with various Innovation technologies e.g. Machine Learning, Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, etc.. Role offers exciting growth opportunities coupling business and technology expertise Investment Banking, Finance, Regulatory, etc.. Build test plans and design test cases based on requirements, user stories and features. Implement test cases and analyze the test outcomes in various test levels. Maintain and update test cases, with focus on continuous improvements. Capture, report and communicate test results to the project and management teams. Follow up on the defects and issues with relevant teams and drive to closure. Participate in the required test meetings as an ambassador of quality assurance and offer test expertise. Continuously identify automation opportunities and implement where needed. Credit Suisse maintains a Working Flexibility Policy, subject to the terms as set forth in the Credit Suisse United States Employment Handbook. You Offer List qualifications, skills and experience expected Quality Assurance, business analysis experience, with a focus on systems analysis and development of business and functional requirements. Proficiency in SQL and working with data files. Experience with project lifecycle delivery. A passion for technology, business and design. You are smart, intellectually curious. column1: Xylem |ˈzīləm| 1 The tissue in plants that brings water upward from the roots; 2 a leading global water technology company. We’re a global team unified in a common purpose creating advanced technology solutions to the world’s water challenges. Developing new technologies that will improve the way water is used, conserved, and re used in the future is central to our work. Our products and services move, treat, analyze, monitor and return water to the environment, in public utility, industrial, residential and commercial building services settings. Xylem also provides a leading portfolio of smart metering, network technologies and advanced analytics solutions for water, electric and gas utilities. In more than 150 countries, we have strong, long standing relationships with customers who know us for our powerful combination of leading product brands and applications expertise with a strong focus on developing comprehensive, sustainable solutions. For more information, please visit us at www.xylem.com If you are excited and passionate about helping us solve water, we want to hear from you! The Role Xylem seeks to hire a Data Science Intern. You will be analyzing millions of time series using state of the art statistical methods, advanced machine learning, and big data technologies. Our data science team is a friendly collaborative environment. If you are excited and passionate to work on state of the art technology trends we want to hear from you! Essential Duties Principal Responsibilities Passion for applications, analytics, storage and distributed systems Enjoy working in a fast paced agile environment using Scrum Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong customer focus Minimum Qualifications Education, Experience, Skills, Abilities, License Certification Currently an accredited University studying toward a Bachelor’s of Science degree in Computer Science, Statistics or equivalent. Experience with object oriented coding languages such as Java and Python Experience with R programming language Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment of engineers to meet aggressive goals and high quality standards Demonstrated experience working with cross functional teams Preferred Qualifications Experience with online distributed systems and platform infrastructure design and implementation Experience with the Hadoop ecosystem and Spark Experience in databases, analytics, big data systems or business intelligence products Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. column3: NC. What the EPA project is about The Office of Research and Development at the EPA supports high quality research to improve the scientific basis for decisions on national environmental issues and help EPA achieve its environmental goals. Research is conducted in a broad range of environmental areas by scientists in EPA laboratories and at universities across the country. The National Center for Computational Toxicology NCCT is responsible for developing computational tools and solutions for improving environmental risk assessments and regulatory decisions pertaining to chemical safety and sustainability. The NCCT Toxicity Reference Database ToxRefDB research project aims to store and analyze legacy in vivo toxicology data. Supporting this effort are various efforts at further curating studies in the database with detailed quantitative information as well as performing more detailed data quality assessments. column1: Xylem |ˈzīləm| 1 The tissue in plants that brings water upward from the roots; 2 a leading global water technology company. We’re a global team unified in a common purpose creating advanced technology solutions to the world’s water challenges. Developing new technologies that will improve the way water is used, conserved, and re used in the future is central to our work. Our products and services move, treat, analyze, monitor and return water to the environment, in public utility, industrial, residential and commercial building services settings. Xylem also provides a leading portfolio of smart metering, network technologies and advanced analytics solutions for water, electric and gas utilities. In more than 150 countries, we have strong, long standing relationships with customers who know us for our powerful combination of leading product brands and applications expertise with a strong focus on developing comprehensive, sustainable solutions. For more information, please visit us at www.xylem.com If you are excited and passionate about helping us solve water, we want to hear from you! Godwin, a Xylem brand, offers a broad product line of fully automatic self priming pumps used in temporary and permanent applications. With a full range of diesel and electric pumps available to purchase or rent, Godwin pumps are used for dewatering and liquids transfer in mining, constructions, municipal and industrial projects around the world. The Role The Operator Field Service role is responsible for loading unloading equipment, installing and dismantling pumps, hoses, pipe and other pumping accessories on customer job sites or branch facilities. The Operator Field Service role will also maintain a clean and orderly work site environment to enable the safe and efficient movement of workers and motorized equipment throughout the site. Essential Duties Principal Responsibilities Identify correct pipe, hose and fittings to fulfill rental and sales contracts. Inspect all items to ensure they are in proper condition for use. Identify equipment that is severely damaged or unsafe to use and notify supervisor to scrap. Work in cooperation with material handlers to safely load equipment on and off trucks and trailers. Be familiar with equipment weights to ensure proper lifting equipment is utilized and overloading is avoided. Understand strap ratings, rigging practices and tag lines. Utilize appropriate securement methods, i.e., chains, straps, etc. when loading equipment. Understand proper loading procedures for cribbing hose and pipe. Follow all safety processes and procedures and maintain a ‘Safety First’ approach when completing daily work tasks. Complete a Job Safety Assessment before beginning any job on a customer site. Assist in installing and dismantling pump systems on customer job sites. Know and understand uses for suction, discharge and flanged hose. Properly connect QD, C&G and flanged fittings. Utilize chain saws and other hand tools to properly cut and break down pipelines. Understand how and where to cut pipe to avoid spills, damage and excessive scrapping. Thoroughly inspect and evaluate condition of pipe, hose and fittings upon dismantling. Notify supervisor or site supervisor if any equipment is damaged Secure all items loaded on the truck for safe over the road travel in accordance with Federal Motor Carriers Safety Administration FMCSA Federal Department of Transportation, and local Department of Transportation guidelines. Review all items to be delivered or picked up with customer to ensure completeness and accuracy. Obtain customer’s signature on Godwin Rental Contract paperwork. Maintain presence of all required driver licenses, medical cards, etc. documents at all times. Maintain log books with entries for driving, on duty, etc. in accordance with DOT guidelines. Maintain mileage and fuel logs as required. Perform daily visual inspections of Godwin delivery equipment and documenting any items in need of service. Comply with all Godwin and customer safety requirements. Available for on call off hours assignments as necessary for emergencies Available for out of town and overnight travel, occasionally up to two weeks Minimum Qualifications Education, Experience, Skills, Abilities, License Certification Valid state issued driver license Forklift certification preferred Knowledge and familiarity with the following General yard equipment Godwin Pumps’ rental equipment and accessories Godwin Pumps’ paper work flow associated with loading unloading equipment Capable of safely operating diesel powered hydraulic lifting equipment i.e. forklifts, front end loaders, tow motors, etc. Ability to safely and effectively operate a company vehicle for extended periods of time throughout cities, job sites, major highways and interstates including tunnels and bridges and in all weather conditions Prior pipe fusion experience with pipe diameters ranging from 4 inches to 36 inches. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Heavy lifting up to 50 lbs. Safely use full range of physical motions associated with general labor work continually throughout 8 hours To include walking, bending, squatting, kneeling, twisting, climbing Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Shop environment, travel required, work on equipment used in water and wastewater industry Standard weekly job hours 40 hours Xylem is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

column1: Job Locations All | US NC Raleigh Posted Date 3 weeks ago9 3 2019 851 AM ID 2019 57363 Overview We believe that our people are the future of the industry. We provide a culture in which our employees can enjoy personal satisfaction, professional achievement and have the ability to strategically map out long term career plans. If you're ready to be a part of something inspiring join us and Discover Your PRA. Who are we? We Are PRA. We are 16,000 employees strong, operating in more than 90 countries. We are committed to saving lives and we are constantly striving to be the best at what we do. Our impact is real and we see it every single day. We help get life saving drugs into the hands of those who need them most. Responsibilities Who are you? You are a strong analytical and critical thinker who can provide strong analysis of key performance indicators and trends. You like data mining, data manipulation and reporting,. You’re an really comfortable in Excel and Tableau. You strive to constantly deliver outstanding service, consistently meeting project deliverables. You aim to produce the highest quality work, while maintaining professionalism, a courteous attitude, and helpful communications with clients and our fellow team members. What will you be doing? The Resourcing Analyst is responsible for supporting a wide range of resource and financial data analysis. Providing instrumental reporting and dashboards. Supporting the Resourcing Departments ability to accurately track Supply and forecast global Hiring needs. Other tasks may include, but are not limited to Perform in depth analyses using a variety of sources to drive the decision making process Independently take accountability and ownership for any corrective action and produce business solutions to Senior Management. Identify and highlight potential issues with resource assignments or levels and take ownership for any corrective action required with minimal support Produce and support customized reporting solutions, as needed Support the management of a Centralized inbox; interpreting and triaging messages, as appropriate Provide possible solutions to risks or issues and take corrective action when required Prioritize and manage multiple complex projects or tasks simultaneously Demonstrate effective organizational and multitasking skills Interpret and apply PRA policies, procedures, and practices Provide oversight and mentoring to more junior level analysts as appropriate Qualifications What do you need to have? Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or its international equivalent in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or analytical field required. Read, write and speak English; fluent in host country language required. Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel including complex formulas, power query and macro VBA. Articulate and professional, can communicate in a clear, positive fashion with clients and staff. To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status. column1: Job Description Job Summary The Senior Demand Planner will lead all aspects of a consensus based monthly demand forecasting process for assigned Wolfspeed Power group business units, encompassing data gathering, analytics, forecasting, and reconciliation of variances. The Senior Demand Planner will work closely with internal stakeholders to reconcile the demand plan with operational, financial, and inventory objectives. What can our company do for you? Passionate Demand Management team who takes pride in delivering excellence Growing, dynamic business unit Wolfspeed Influence and directly contribute to the development of a new organizational role and processes Cross functional and change management leadership opportunity Act as a key business partner to Product Line General Managers What can you do for our company? Develop and own all aspects of the Product Line Demand Forecast Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Business Unit leaders, Finance, and the Distribution teams to develop a demand forecast Communicate with Operations, Marketing, Sales and Finance to ensure translation of the demand plan across and through the organization, reconciling differences Drive a consensus process Reconcile the operational plan with business strategy, manufacturing, and financial objectives Proactively communicate significant changes in demand throughout the organization including key assumptions and risks and opportunities Develop strong relationships with Sales, Distribution management, Operations, Finance, Product Line Management, and Marketing to enable success Develop overall plans to effectively manage inventory, maximize customer service levels, drive inventory efficiencies and ensure forecast and planning parameters are in sync. Influence cross functional team to promote optimal business decisions thru data driven insights and effective communication Operate as a strategic thought leader change agent, working collaboratively with various functions on priority initiatives that improve forecast accuracy, optimize inventories, and provide superior service to internal business partners and external customers Create balanced solutions to reconcile disparate objectives Drive continuous improvements across the Demand Management organization utilizing industry best practices and innovative methodologies Monitor metrics and exception reporting to identify forecast improvement opportunities Support ad hoc requests and participate on project teams, as needed What you need for success Us citizen or Green card holder Bachelors Degree in Business Management, Supply Chain Management, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Finance or Engineering 7 years professional experience. Minimum 5 years of Demand Planning and Forecasting experience Experience with forecast modeling, databases and statistics Strong analytical skills and experience, with advanced knowledge and proficiency in Microsoft Excel and working knowledge of data warehouse business intelligence software tools Tableau preferred Demonstrated ability to translate data sets into meaningful insights to influence optimal decisions with cross functional partners Experience presenting a demand forecast to management in an S&OP environment Detail oriented with strong analytical, organizational, decision making, problem solving and presentation skills Passionate, self motivator, driven to achieve business objectives Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills Proven ability to manage by influence” cross functional teams without formal authority Ability to drive effective business conversations with senior leaders and cross functional partners Works effectively both independently as well as within a team environment Ability to thrive in a fast paced, rapidly changing working environment Navigates effectively through ambiguous processes Highly preferred skills and certifications MBA or advanced degree Semiconductor or high tech industry experience Demonstrated strong business acumen and end to end supply chain knowledge Experience across multiple aspects of the supply chain, i.e. with previous roles in inventory management, manufacturing planning, distribution channel management, sales forecasting, etc. Basic understanding of business finance Proficiency with statistical modeling and demand planning software Comfortable analyzing large and unrefined data sets Working knowledge SQL, Oracle, Salesforce Advanced knowledge Tableau, Microsoft Excel Expertise in data acquisition, spreadsheet database development and analysis Overview At Cree | Wolfspeed, we’ve spent more than 30 years developing industry firsts as a leader in wide bandgap semiconductor technology. Not familiar with all of our products? That is because we are a part of the invisible revolution; if we do our job right you will never know we were there. Our products make impossible possible like our LEDs that power cities to our Silicon Carbide SiC and Gallium Nitride GaN components that power electric vehicles, solar energy, telecommunications and industrial, military and aerospace solutions. We believe in enabling the world to do more with less. That’s why we encourage each other to think unconventionally, take ownership and solve real problems. Interested in a career at Cree | Wolfspeed? We want to meet you. Submit your application now. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
